message.content:
The verb tenses are as follows:

1. Present Simple Tense: We use present simple tense to talk about actions that happen now or at some time in the future. 
Example: I eat every day. (present simple)

2. Present Continuous Tense: This is formed by using 'to be' + present verb + '-ing'. It describes an action that is happening at this very moment.
Example: We are eating now. (present continuous)

3. Past Simple Tense: We use past simple tense to talk about actions that happened in the past. 
Example: I ate breakfast. (past simple)

4. Past Continuous Tense: This is formed by using 'to be' + past verb + '-ing'. It describes an action that was happening at a certain point in the past.
Example: We were eating when he arrived. (past continuous)

5. Present Perfect Tense: This tense is used to describe actions that happened before now but are connected to the present. 
Example: I have finished my work. (present perfect)

6. Past Perfect Tense: It is formed by using 'to have' + past verb + '-ed'. It describes an action which was completed at some point in the past.
Example: I had eaten before he arrived. (past perfect)

7. Present Perfect Continuous Tense: This tense is formed by using 'to be' + present verb + '-ing' and the auxiliary verb 'have' + past participle of the main verb. It describes an action which has been ongoing for a long time or since before he came. 
Example: I have been eating since breakfast. (present perfect continuous)

8. Past Perfect Continuous Tense: This tense is formed by using 'to have' + present verb + '-ing' and the auxiliary verb 'have' + past participle of the main verb. It describes an action which had been ongoing for a long time or since before he came. 
Example: We had been eating when he arrived. (past perfect continuous)
